Instruction:
Task Description: The task involves creating a gRPC probe client in Go that can establish connections to gRPC servers, perform various probe operations (echo, read, write), and collect metrics about the probe results.

Struct Description: The Probe struct represents a gRPC probe client that manages connections to multiple targets, performs probe operations, and tracks results.

Fields:

name: [string] - The name of the probe instance
src: [string] - The source identifier for the probe
opts: [*options.Options] - Configuration options for the probe
c: [*configpb.ProbeConf] - gRPC probe-specific configuration
l: [*logger.Logger] - Logger for recording probe events
dialOpts: [[]grpc.DialOption] - Options for gRPC dialing
targets: [[]endpoint.Endpoint] - List of target endpoints to probe
cancelFuncs: [map[string]context.CancelFunc] - Map of cancel functions for target operations
targetsMu: [sync.Mutex] - Mutex for synchronizing access to targets
results: [map[string]*probeRunResult] - Map of probe results by target

Methods:

connectWithRetry: [func(ctx context.Context, tgt, msgPattern string, result *probeRunResult) *grpc.ClientConn] -> [*grpc.ClientConn] - Establishes a gRPC connection to the target with retry logic, using the specified context, target address, message pattern, and result tracker. Returns the established connection or nil if failed.

oneTargetLoop: [func(ctx context.Context, tgt string, index int, result *probeRunResult)] -> [None] - Main probe loop for a single target that continuously performs probe operations (echo/read/write) at regular intervals, using the specified context, target address, target index, and result tracker. Manages connection lifecycle and records metrics.
